model

Class Rabbit

  • java.lang.Object
    • model.Animal
      • model.Rabbit
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Actor

    public class Rabbit
extends Animal
    A simple model of a rabbit. Rabbits age, move, breed, eat, and die.
    Version:
    2012.02.07
    Author:
    David J. Barnes and Michael Kolling, Marco, Malcolm, Harold

    • Constructor Detail

      • Rabbit

        public Rabbit(boolean randomAge,
      Field field,
      Location location,
      Simulator brain)
        Create a new rabbit. A rabbit may be created with age zero (a new born) or with a random age.
        Parameters:
        randomAge - If true, the rabbit will have a random age.
        field - The field currently occupied.
        location - The location within the field.

    • Method Detail

      • act

        public void act(java.util.List<Actor> newRabbits)
        This is what the rabbit does most of the time - it runs around. Sometimes it will breed or die of old age.
        Specified by:
        act in interface Actor
        Specified by:
        act in class Animal
        Parameters:
        newRabbits - A list to add newly born rabbits to.

      • findFood

        public Location findFood(Location location)
        Lets the rabbit find food. If he finds grass his foodlevel will be boosted
        Parameters:
        location - Location of the rabbit
        Returns:

      • incrementHunger

        public void incrementHunger()
        Decreases foodlevel. If foodlevel is 0 or below it kills the rabbit
